>>Weather Tomsk

The climatic conditions in Tomsk are mostly characterized by a frigid and moderate climate. Tomsk is a city with a significant rainfall. Even in the driest month there is a lot of rain. Köppen and Geiger classify this climate as Dfb. The average annual temperature is 0.9 °C | 33.5 °F in Tomsk. The rainfall here is around 610 mm | 24.0 inch per year.

Tomsk is located in the northern hemisphere. The balmy days of Summer commence at the end of June and conclude in September. This period encompasses the months: June, July, August, September.

Climate graph // Weather by Month Tomsk

In February, the precipitation level plummets to a mere 29 mm | 1.1 inch. This month holds the title for being exceptionally arid. Most of the precipitation here falls in July, averaging 69 mm | 2.7 inch.

average temperature by month Tomsk

The month of highest temperature is July during which the average temperature reaches up to 18.8 °C | 65.9 °F. January is the coldest month, with temperatures averaging -18.8 °C | -1.8 °F.

Hours of sunshine in Tomsk

avg. hours of sun

Total hours of sun

In this location, the month that receives most sunshine is June, with a mean number of daily hours being 12.71. Across the entire duration of said calendar period there are an aggregate total of 381.17 hours' worth of sunlight.

In Tomsk, the month that experiences the least number of daily sunshine hours is January with an average duration of 1.63 hours per day. The total amount of sunlight recorded during this period in question stands at a sum total of 50.48.

In Tomsk, an average of 80.44 hours of sunshine are counted per month and around 2453.02 hours throughout the year.
